name: Harmonic Reasoning
definition: Multi-layer approach combining AI perspectives, logical analysis, and knowledge search
examples: Trinity debate + Zürich logic + Brain search for comprehensive analysis
ASI fusion layer synthesizing all three systems
description: Harmonic reasoning represents a balanced approach to problem-solving that leverages artificial intelligence, pure logic, and accumulated knowledge

name: ASI Meta-Fusion
definition: Layer that combines Trinity (perspectives), Zürich (logic), and Brain (knowledge)
examples: User query → Trinity debate (5 perspectives) → Zürich reasoning (logic) → Brain search (knowledge) → ASI synthesis
description: ASI fusion enables meta-level reasoning by orchestrating all three reasoning systems in parallel

name: Keyword Indexing
definition: RAM-based index of brain files for instant search without loading full CBOR chunks
examples: Index maps keywords to file references
Multi-keyword search returns intersection of matching files
description: Indexing enables O(1) keyword lookup across the 8TB brain memory
